reviews.review_text: Beautiful plating and great service. Dont like the snack portions fool you, the mains are a LOT of food! Everything we had was delicious (pictures are portions for 3 people, so we got an extra curry as part of the meal)

Went to Vancouver for a business trip.  Met up with some friends who lives in Vancouver and recommend trying Maenam. Cute small Thai restaurant with a very cool modern vibe. Service was excellent with the server being super attentive. We decided to go for their 13 course tasting menu. I wasn t able to post all the pics as it only allows me to add 10 pics to this post. The food was so amazing, small amounts so you can taste the flavours and also so you won t get too full. The tasting menu was interesting there was food that I otherwise would not have ordered at a standard thai restaurant.  The server explained each dish that came to the table. All in all a very unique experience, the desserts were so good! In love tasting menus. This one is a must try!!

Wow !! What can I say? Food was absolutely phenomenal, the snacks at the beginning were small but were packed with punches of flavour!! We had a reservation and did the tasting menu about $80 a person and we definitely left with full bellies! My aunt was visiting from out of town and she was absolutely blown away! Street parking on 4th was expensive so try and find parking in the residential areas!

An excellent spot for enjoying Thai cuisine, offering a delightful and reasonably priced dining experience. The quality of the food is exceptional, particularly the dumplings, vegetarian green curry, and coconut soup, which we found to be incredibly delicious. Similar to many establishments in Vancouver, this place caters to a diverse range of dietary preferences, ensuring that even vegans have at least one suitable choice. Additionally, their happy hour drinks are highly enjoyable. One aspect that stood out to us was the variety of options available on the menu. Whether you were a meat lover, a vegetarian, or a vegan, there were numerous choices to suit every palate. It was refreshing to see a restaurant that prioritized inclusivity and catered to different dietary needs without compromising on taste or quality. During our visit, we decided to explore the happy hour offerings, and we were not disappointed. The selection of drinks was impressive, with a range of creative and well-crafted cocktails, along with other beverage options. It was a fantastic opportunity to try something new and indulge in refreshing concoctions that complemented the flavors of the food perfectly.

I ve lived in Vancouver 13 years and Meanam is my absolute FAVORITE restaurant in all the city.  It is a culinary adventure you will not forget.  I go here for all of my most special occasions.  Yes it s a bit on the pricier side, but for the top quality you get, more than worth it.
Recommend chefs menu if you want to try something new! We always order the same Thai food but this chef s menu really gives us a totally different thai food experience from starter to desserts.
Just go. Try the chefs tasting menu. It won t disappoint. Also, pick up a cookbook on your way out so you can try to relive the wondrous experience from the comfort of your own home.
I enjoyed the dishes a lot. Flavour was wow. The appetizers were my favourite. The least favourite was seafood pad cha stir fry Food

We ve always enjoyed this place for their delicious Thai cuisine with a modern West coast twist!  The restaurant itself is beautifully designed and furnished; and the presentation of their dishes match their elevated cafe-style dining room.  Yes, items found on their menu definitely are priced higher than your average Thai restaurant, however; you could definitely taste the freshness and the quality of their seasonal ingredients.  For example, their green papaya salad served over a whole grilled local sweet corn smart flavours and super tasty!  They also have a good selection of cocktails and drinks too.  The overall experience for me has been very pleasant!  Would most recommend this place for dates!

Everything was perfect! I don t remember the name of the food but the food was gorgeous and tasty!!! The atmosphere was stunning. Moreover, the staff are all nice and friendly. My friend and I really had a good time and enjoyed the food and service here. thank you thank you.

We had a wonderful dining experience. The flavors were incredible and the staff were very attentive. We had the price-fixed menu with the wine pairing and it was amazing! Extremely delightful and knowledgeable chef. Exquisite, artistic and delicious dishes with fresh ingredients prepared from scratch. Distinctive and well-balanced flavor and teste. Love Thai cup cake at first bit. usually I always let my camera eat first but this meal I enjoyed it so much completely forgot to shoot photos Wine pairing both options (BC & French flight )are prefect pair with food and dessert I ordered them twice as perfect match ! Highly recommended

Really good drinks and delicious curry! All the material they use were fresh and done right  The use of spices gave depth to their dishes without overpowering the flavour. Would love to come back for dinner!
Delicious $88 11 course meal. Friendly staff. Great atmosphere. Clean. Bathroom kind of smelly

The best Thai food in the city from Chef Angus An. Lunch is a treat as there is a variety of ever-changing dishes that come with soup, salad and rice. We had the green curry halibut with fragrant green curry, local sturgeon, sweet peppers, Thai eggplant, holy & Thai basil and the prawn stir-fry with long beans, sweet peppers, Thai basil, and fried garlic. Their wine list is excellent should you desire a good pairing.

Maenam has great reviews and I hadn t gone for a while, so I used Dineout as an excuse to come back. Their dineout menu isn t the typical 3 course: appetizer, entree, dessert, it s made to share and because of that, there s more variety. There were some dishes that were standard, while others stood out to me. The Hot and Sour Soup was quite standard, good amount of seafood in it though and a great way to start your meal. I will say I expected more Salad from the Fried Squid Salad, but it was literally just Fried Squid. I didn t even think it was that good and would personally order a different salad. Highlights was definitely the Duck and Lingcod. The Duck Leg Curry was full of flavour, which balanced well with rice. I thought the Confit was a great call because the meat so fall off the bone tender, yet it wasn t a heavy or oily dish. As for the Lingcod, I think it was shallow fried to have the skin nice and crispy. I also appreciated the fact that this dish had the most veggies and the flavour was on point. It was my favourite dish. The Bua Loy was also very good - it s a dish if you like that QQ texture or just chewy mochi type balls in general. They used what tasted like a savory coconut milk, so it wasn t too sweet at all and very light. As for the Cashew Mor Kaeng, I wasn t really a fan, purely because I don t really like custard desserts, but my friends liked it. Overall, I had a great experience here. I like how it s quite a cozy intimate vibe that also offers good service. Food was generally good and I think dineout makes it worth a visit.

I absolutely loved my experience here! Had their tasting menu which honestly was quite a bit of food! It is definitely a spin on Thai food and I did not think it was necessary very traditional which was not a bad thing in my opinion. I love spice and some of the food was quite spicy (so heads up). The cocktails were 10/10! Would definitely go back and a would recommend. Loved that they also had a veggie tasting menu option (didn t try it) but not sure how it would work if not everyone in your party didn t want the veggie option.

The most delicious Thai cuisine I have ever had! Everything tastes beautiful, I feel like my tongue is having a fantastic feast during eating time. Especially the final dessert, it really stole my heart~

A great place to eat Thai food. It was a really nice experience and fair place. Food is very good, we ordered dumplings, vegetarian green curry and coconut soup and it was very very good. As most of the places in Vancouver they have options for everyone so even if you are vegan you will have at least an option. Also happy hour drinks are very good.

Maenam is delicious & accommodating! Obviously expensive, but worth it for a special treat. The chef s menu was generous and wholly delectable. Their Tom Kha soup is out of this world & one of the best soups I ve ever had. We had a gluten free, vegan, & peanut allergy table and somehow they made a delicious meal for us. Thank you, Maenam! Vegetarian options: Vegan Dietary restrictions: Celeriac friendly

We re in love! Cocktails, food + service are all chefs kiss! Absolutely amazing. Still talking about the incredible experience we had last night and planning our next visit. Ask the team for their recommendations as we absolutely loved EVERYTHING the bartender + server recommended to us.

The best Thai food in Vancouver, hands down! The 3-flavour pork rib is spectacular, and the pad Thai is a perfect companion for it. The texture of the noodles is far beyond anything I ve experienced before... you can really taste the freshness. Beyond that though, the rest of the flavours and textures are also amazing. I left full and very satisfied. Oh, and the service was excellent.
One of my favourite places! Food is always incredible and I appreciate when the kitchen is willing to make changes to accommodate dietary preferences. Service has always been lovely as well.

Had the chef tasting menu for me and my date. Its a casual dining place but it offers many fine dining style cuisine. The food tasted amazing and there was way more food than we expected as the title of tasting kind of threw us off. There were 2 main dish which was flavoured amazing well with the spices and food that I usually dislike or avoid tasted great as well. Service was very fast and profession, well worth the time and effort to reserve a table here.

Fantastic experience at Maenam tonight. We were welcomed like family and the food was amazing. I highly recommend doing the Chefs tasting dinner, be brave and let them surprise you. You will not be disappointed! Love the food? Pick up a copy of the cookbook to make some of the dishes at home or do some take out

Havent been here in 7 or 8 years but it was just as good as I remember. Every dish was excellent - dumplings and the wagyu beef salad particular standouts. A good BC wine selection, many of them organic/biodynamic.

I absolutely love this restaurant. The food and fantastic service are the reason why they were one of Vancouver Magazine s best restaurants (for multiple years). If you can t decide, opt for the tasting menu. Food is delicious, flavourful and unexpected. The tastes and textures are truly delicious - so min creativity in what seems like simple dishes. I ve been here many times and never had something I didn t like. And don t skip dessert - always refreshing and tasty even if you don t have a sweet tooth. What adds the icing is the service. Maenam never feels like it s lacking in staff. Water glasses are kept full, staff are friendly and helpful - it tops off your dining experience. Cannot recommend Maenam enough.

Friendly staff, pleasant environment and unique but tasty dishes are major impressions of mine. We were having a satisfying dinner here. Sweet Sticky Rice is fabulous!!! Definitely will come back again.

I rarely give 5 stars, but this place deserves it. For so many reasons. The food is excellent, and the Chefs tasting menu is a must do. We got 7 courses of the the most exquisite and finely prepared flavourful food. It may seem a bit expensive, but its worth it! The staff is very friendly and very responsive. I went with my spouse to celebrate her birthday, and had informed them beforehand. They took extra care that our experience was memorable. From the complimentary bubbly to the candles on the dessert. Its the little things that count, and the staff aced it. Would highly recommend Maenam!

First time here yesterday for my birthday. What a show stopper! Our table ordered the chef tasting menu (pescatarian option  but no shellfish for us. They were able to accommodate this dietary restriction). Every single dish was tasty and I would order them all again. The tasting menu is the way to go to really get a lot of different options. It s expensive but lots of food, and you get to try many more dishes than you d get ordering the regular way. My one complaint is that with so many dishes coming at the same time I felt a little rushed. Food this beautiful and tasty should be savoured. But I don t want things to get cold. I asked if they could slow down the other dishes but was told  it s family style, it all comes out at once.  Perhaps it s easier for the kitchen, but I felt rushed. Next time I ll probably order a la carte and only order the next dish when I m ready to eat it! Despite that, the presentation was beautiful and overall good service and nice intimate ambience as well. The Brussels sprouts were likely my favorite and I ll come back just for them another day! It was a great way to celebrate a special occasion! My friends ordered the wine pairings and they enjoyed all three of the wines as well.

Excellent flavors. My favorites were the massaman curry of beef (beef is amazingly tender), grilled thai sausage and crispy rice salad, and 3 flavour pork rib (rib portions are small but the vegetables that come with it were delicious). My only disappointment is when ordering pickup you need to ask for the thai jasmine rice which is listed as complimentary for the pick-up order. Other than that mistake on our part the 15% off on pickup orders is a nice bonus.

Like nothing Ive had before. Highly recommend the tasting menu where you get a bit of everything. Each dish had an everlasting taste; the more you chewed, the more flavour came out. It was incredible. Looking forward to dining here again!
Amazing Thai restaurant with tasty food! I wished I was told ahead of time that a party of 5 people or more is forced to do the tasting menu

Top quality restaurant, well deserving of its spot in the best restaurants in Canada. Thai food like no other, the chefs menu is excellently priced and will leave you full as ever. The service is impeccable and the cocktails are 10/10. My only draw back is that they do no have beer on tap, the cans and bottles they do carry however are well sourced.

Thai food was very delicious. Eating at the bar was pleasant. Service was quick and kind I appreciate the cooks ability to make dishes minimally spicy. Non alcoholic mango ginger was very tasty. I would definitely recommend for a special occasion

We absolutely love Maenam s pescatarian tasting menu - this has been our go-to for years and it always leave our bellies happy and wanting more. From the appies to the entrees, every bite packs a punch and is a symphony flavours that makes our mouths sing. Pad Thai is fantastic too but the tasting menu - wow, I think it offers you one of the best value in town! Last night we discovered a new favorite dish - grilled sockeye salmon salad - don t let the simple name fool ya, it hits all the flavour palate and is totally umami and the salmon was grilled to perfection Service is also second to none. Do not hesitate, just go eeeeat!

We visit Maenam every year in the last 6 years and its always been such a wonderful experience. They combine interesting flavours and always offer great service. I really enjoyed this years lingcod and Gati curry. As a Vietnamese girl at heart, I appreciate all the hints of fish sauce used their cooking too! Thank you for always providing us with such a wonderful experience.

This place is great!  We were totally blown away by the quality of the food, the flavours, the presentation and the service.  You know when the prices of the food at restaurants are expensive because of the ingredients? Maenam also has the masterful art of cooking in each dish reflected in its price. We ordered the chicken satay, pork sausage salad, papaya salad to start. The chicken was tender and juicy. The pork sausage salad was a real highlight; it had crunchy rice and really flavourful sausage pieces. As with all their dishes, each flavour stands out equally so we were able to taste each wave of flavour in each dish. For the mains, we ordered the pad Thai, beef tenderloin and lamb shank. The pad Thai ranks up with the best in Vancouver. The kale chips with the meat dishes were a surprise! We were not a fan of kale beforehand but the crisp was a great way to add textures. The desserts were the coconut ice cream with caramel and the taro and pandan dumplings. These desserts were a great way to finish the meal, to neutralize the spice and end in a different flavour tone. All in all, Maenam lives up the hype and we cannot wait to go back and try the rest of the menu.

Super amazing experience and we left so full. Between two people we shared the crispy fried chicken wings, grilled thai sausage and crispy rice salad, pad thai with prawns, red curry with braised beef, and a side of jasmine rice. The fried chicken wings were super crispy and well seasoned. The tamarind dipping sauce is SO GOOD, I was eating it on its own after we finished the wings. The rice salad is served hot. It was crispy and had flavourful little rice bombs with tons of delicious pork layered throughout. The portion and sizing of this dish was very generous. The pad thai was pretty good and also generously portioned but I would expect that given the dish is $20, which is rather high for pad thai. The red curry was my favourite dish. It was super rich and decadent, and the braised beef was falling apart it was so tender.

Love the place, food tastes like authentic thai flavor. Nice staffs too, we were late about 15 mins on that they and they changed our reservation time for after 15 mins for us to have more time to dine in I really love their mussels, with the sauce and the mussels were perfectly cooked and no bad smell or grainy at all
Perfect way to enjoy the Maenam experience. Dine out tasting menu. From the start to finish each dish was delicious. So many flavour points from sweet, savory and refreshing.

Amazing food. Try the sablefish soup, the Green curry halibut and the wagyu beef. Personally I like my food a bit more spicy but this was a great. We had this with a side of roti, peanut sauce, and jasmine rice. Portions were large, couldnt finish all the food. Atmosphere was also very nice. Look was clean and modern staff were busy but definitely available. Would recommend to my friends and I will definitely go back.

Some of the best Thai food Ive ever had. We chose to go with the chefs tasting menu which incorporates 6 different dishes plus dessert. It was incredible. Delicious very tasty dishes and the service was great too.
Had a really good meal here! I dont eat spicy at all and some of these dishes were a bit spicy for me, but extremely flavorful. Would definitely recommend.

I love their pad thai!! Their dineout menu was worth a try with delicious fried cod/chicken which have seemed like they were fried just at the perfect temp/time Just a minor thing but servers were talking with each other too long so it took awhile for us to ask them for the bill but overall great restaurant

Meanam has been one of my favourite restaurants in Vancouver for over 10 years. Every meal there is fantastic, but recently they truly set a new standard for how accommodating a restaurant can be. My friend made a bookshelf no for a special occasion. She said, in our group there is a vegan, vegetarian, person with a nut allergy (not anaphylactic) and person with celiac disease (gluten free). The host said, that s no problem. We shared the tasting menu and every dish met our combined dietary requirements, and let me tell you, it was delicious. That s a really tough combination of dietary restrictions and the staff at Maenam did not bat an eye. Thank you thank you thank you for such an incredible meal.
Worth the price, food was delicious and there was so many different dishes to eat. Staff was very attentive and friendly. Would visit again.

I had wanted to go here for a while and it did not disappoint   the food was really delicious, with unique flavours and menu options. The drink selection was also really interesting and tasty   Would recommend making a reservation because it can get busy, even on a week night!
Best cocktails I ve ever had! The atmosphere and food were also amazing. Highly recommend.
Really great value for their chefs tasting menu. Everything was very flavorful and delicious

So my partner brought me to this place for my birthday. We live in the neighborhood and we always walked past here but had never come in before. Boy oh boy did Kate (The owner) and JD (The bar manager) made us feel like home and treated us like royals. First of all, the ambience is amazing. Chic and modern. We ordered the steamed local mussles for starters and green curry of halibut + stir fry of purple eggplant & crispy pork belly for entrees. Nothing was greasy, everything went so well with the rice we ordered, and the flavor was just right in all of the plates (I was especially obsessed with the crispy pork). I cannot say enough good things about this place and am so happy we found this gem. We are planning on returning next week. This made us realize the type of business we want to support especially during COVID, and Kate runs an ethical business that prioritizes customers. New favorite place for sure and I would encourage you to give it a try.
Fantastic food and service. Loved the set menu.  Cant wait to go back for the next set menu. Good innovative drink menu.  Keep up the great work.

Perfection. We did tasting menu and blew our minds.  Must try!!! Curry Halibut is heavenly.  Amazing, empathetic, and caring service. It s as if you walked into a family dinner table,They definitely deserve their michelin star. Honestly the best gourmet Thai food in North America.  Perfect for anniversary, or spoiling someone for their birthday! Do it.

Nice place to go!! Nice food I have found Thai food in Vancouver long time and finally I got this amazing place to go for Thai food. It was so good, this is what everyone wants for Thai food! Really good atmosphere and food having dinner with your friends, family, love.

Some of the best Thai you ll get in Vancouver. Get the tasting menu with a few friends and you ll leave waddling out the door in a Thai food coma. The lamb panang curry and halibut green curry were heavenly and just perfectly spicy to know you re eating Thai food. We also had a yummy pork shoulder soup, mussels steamed with lemongrass and chilis   the mussels were beyond fresh.

Great experience. Ordered the tasting menu and was not disappointed. Went as a group of 4 and the tasting menu was sufficient and given in good amounts. The service was excellent. Favorite dish of the night was the grilled tuna salad. Amazing

The food here is out of this world delicious! Fresh ingredients, popping flavor, beautiful plating. The quality of food is well worth the price. No wonder Trip Advisor says this is number one best Thai food restaurant in Vancouver, BC

I recently went to Maenam for the first time for dinner with my family. I am a huge thai food fan and was blown away. Quality of the food was exceptional and service (from the GM) was impeccable even though he was multi-tasking like crazy. We ordered a ton of food and we were very happy to have leftovers. Although hard to choose, standouts was the mushroom soup, chicken wings and pad thai. Finished off the meal also with a delish espresso. Will absolutely recommend this to ALL and will be back.

We went here on a recommendation. Wow! I love Thai in the first place, but this place is well above par. The service was spectacular, the cocktails blew us away, and of course, the food: unbelievable! We ate at the bar and had terrific company the whole meal, with our bartender. I recommend the tasting menu. 5-6 courses of surprise after surprise. I cannot wait to go back. Back to the unique and mind bending cocktails: we enjoyed a few of the house signature drinks. I cannot recommend them more highly! Eat here!
Loved Maenam.  Great flavours and atmosphere.  Had a fantastic time.  My friend and i sat at the bar and JD the bartender was awesome.  Super friendly and knowledgeable.  Great recommendations.

Dine Out Vancouver February 23rd, 2021 at Maenam Restaurant was a wonderfully delicious event with such a very warm welcoming and a fine dining atmosphere with all the Covid-19 recommendations in place..we felt totally safe and protected..the Thai dishes served at this restaurant were very authentic and the staff were exceptionally helpful in detailing the ingredients in each dish and providing useful hints on enjoying the intense fresh flavours...
Very good experience; tasting menu was great. Restaurant was full, but the service was quick.

Went there for the extended dine out menu which was amazing! The Penang curry and duck salad were to die for!! The dessert was okay but the panacotta has a very strong tea flavour so if youre indifferent about tea then probably dont order it. Huge wine selection mostly by the bottle so you are limited if you just want a glass or two.
Came in for lunch and was delighted by every dish. Papaya salad, green curry with halibut cheek, and Penang curry. Every dish was flavourful and deftly spiced. Can t wait to try more.

Decided to give Maenam a try on the basis of its consistently great reviews and its interesting takeout menu. All I can say is Wow!  Every dish from our chicken wings appetizer, to dish featuring bbq pork jowl and finally a chicken curry was fabulous. The restaurants Phad Thai was simply the best we have ever had. And all of the dishes travel well. Were going back for more soon. Going to try their BC Spot Prawn offering, or maybe we will just get what we did last week.  Sooooo good.
Bangkok beehive cocktail is spectacular. Cod main dish was very tasty as well.

Came in for a Dinner Date March 5th. Very welcoming establishment. The service was excellent,  both our server and Bartender took care of our needs, as for the food...was the best tasting flavors Ive had in a long time. Food was cooked perfectly. The bottle of Rose we chose paired perfectly with what we ate! Definitely want to come back...been craving the smoked duck since I left

One of the best lunch places in Vancouver! We got the pork, fried chicken, beef and prawn stir fry, all of which were amazing. Also really enjoyed the soup that came with each meal, cannot recommend this place enough!

Such wonderful creations. The scallop with pomegranate was tasty and unique. Love the kick off spice to it. The beef cheeks curry pairs well with the pickled cucumber and Jasmine rice. I really couldnt stop eating.
The coconut soup is really good Try it And the seafoods are also very fresh Sparkling rose is also nice Solid 5 stars
Been there twice. I m amazed by every single dishes. The best Thai food I ever had in Vancouver.

Omg, the food is beyond excellent. The lunch menu is well priced. It comes with a main, a papaya salad, soup, rice, naan bread depending on the order. Definitely deserve all the stars and Michelin Guide!

Fantastic as always! We ordered Wagyu beef salad, halibut green curry and fried eggplant with pork belly with steamed jasmine rice. It was so delicious,  completely forgot to take a picture.  I did get one of my drink, a ginger infused rye with passion fruit juice. Id give  6 stars out of 5 if possible!

The food is amazing and Maenam absolutely deserves its place on the Michelin Guide. We got the Chefs tasting menu (veg, pescatarian, and meat options), and it was worth every cent from presentation to quality. There are some reviews that complain about the service, but I very strongly disagree. We had amazing service from a very kind staff. Great for a date spot or otherwise. Vegetarian options: They are very accommodating to veg diets. Dietary restrictions: They checked with us on dietary restrictions and accommodated.
5 star experience! Service, atmosphere and food all excellent. One of the best dining experiences Ive had in Vancouver. Sablefish+ curry dish is the best Ive ever tasted.

Out of this world Thai food that is not your typical white person thai. Incredibly rich flavors with wonderful mixes of tang, sweetness, spice and saltiness. We ordered the corn/papaya salad, the sausage appy and the albacore tuna curry. We also picked the Thai ginger cocktail and a good wild fermented and canned beer, both of which went really well with our meals. Our waitress was incredibly hospitable. She even brought us a free dessert which was like nothing we ve ever had before and totally hit the spot with a mix of coconut cream, fruit, water chestnuts, and young coconut. I m from Portland Oregon where we have a plethora of good food but nothing like this. These flavors were all enticing and so satisfying. So much going on in our mouths and so much originality. I m so grateful we ate here and hope you do too!

The tasting menu was fantastic! We decided $75/person was reasonable for a nice date night, and we were rewarded with tons and tons of delicious food. A much more elegant take on Thai food than anything Id had before, and everything we tried was delicious and packed a big ol punch of flavor. Only complaint would be the pacing of the meal - the 3 different entrees could barely fit on the table and it was hard to enjoy them all at the same time. Still, the service was excellent and the food was delicious!
It is very nice Thai food restaurant. It is not very busy but the food is very good. Love their menus, good service.
If you havent been to mae nam, go! It lives up to its reviews you will not be disappointed. Definitely amongst one of the best Thai experiences you will have in Vancouver
Dont walk by, walk in. Attentive staff, delicious and fresh food. In a calm atmosphere with nice music. I had a great experience, will return and recommend.

In Vancouver for business and ordered takeout for dinner- it was amazing! We shared the Crispy Brussels Sprouts Salad, Tom Kha Coconut Mushroom Soup, Vegetarian Gaeng Gari, and the Vegan Pad Thai. Impressive variety of vegan menu items and generous portions. I was told Maenam holds a Michelin Star and I believe it! The best vegan take out Ive ever had, with enough leftovers for us both the next day. Highly recommend for best thai food in Vancouver and Ill definitely be back! Try them out, you wont be disappointed. Thank you for a dinner experience that exceeded expectations!

We came here for dine out the last two years and we loved it so much! Very authentic Thai dishes and feels like Im in Thailand again. My favourite dish was for sure the Penang curry. My only regret is that the dish was taken away too soon before we could use the leftover curry sauce for the rice
Absolutely incredible! Best Thai cuisine Ive ever had. Fresh, flavour, inspired.

We loved every aspect of this restaurant!! The thai food was innovative and unexpected, the best meal of our stay - even with a selective (picky) daughter and two teen boys! The pad thai was my favorite, non-traditional and superb. The sticky rice with crunchies was also up there as a favorite. The service was swift and precise. This will be our first dinner next time we come to town. Do not miss this restaurant if you want the best Asian food in the city!
Absolutely in my top 5 in the city...never fails...food and service spot on...bill with 20% tip around $150 for 2 people
Creative and full of flavour.
Amazing food and service. The crockery serving with their food is stunning beautiful. Definitely recommended

What an amazing selection for vegetarians. Absolutely loved the food, I wish we should have dine-in. Flavors were bursting in every bite, loved how warm our delivery package was given its winter. Thanks for the lovely food, it really has a soul to it

Love this place ! Came on a first date 8 years ago and it s been our place ever since. Those beetle leaf appys , pad Thai , salmon salad , green papaya salad, green curry, the cocktails - love it all! Highly recommend
Had the tasting menu for dinner. Absolutely superb. I highly recommend everyone try both lunch and dinner here. Ill be coming back to try the tasting menu again for sure.
The most authentic Thai restaurant in Vancouver. Please dont just go and order the Phad Thai. Thai cuisine is so much more than Phad Thai. Give the tasting menu a try.
Just amazing. Very good thai food with localized PNW ingredients
Really good Thai food that is non-traditional, chef An is very talented.

What a nice surprise this place was! I went there last night and was so impressed. I feel like every time I go out I end up having something that tastes like stuff I had before. Not here! Everything was very surprising and delicious and tasted so fresh. The food can be spicy, but it s the kind of spicy that brings out the flavour instead of covering it. The sablefish soup is to die for!
Chefs tasting menu

Lovely restaurant with great ambiance! The cocktails at Maenam are a must try - they work really well paired with the food and on their own. Bartender Diego deserves a special note, his friendliness and lovely attitude absolutely made our night!

The cocktails, food and service were great. Nothing but warm service and wonderful flavours. I have the Thai and  ginger cocktail that was just how it was described on the menu. The staff kept checking in on us to see if we needed anything. Go, you will not regret it.

Some of the best Thai food Ive ever had! Ive spent many months in Thailand throughout my life and had lots of authentic Thai food, however, the food served at Maenam is by some of the best Ive ever had. I had the chefs selection and I couldnt have been happier. So much food and such a large variety of tastes, it would be nearly impossible to not like most, if not all of the dishes. Also, the staff is great. Some very friendly individuals. Ive met the owner as well, and what a lovely lady I must say! You can tell the restaurant is run as if its a big family. Overall, I cant recommend this restaurant enough. If your looking for great authentic Thai food or just an amazing restaurant in general, look no further! I promise you wont be disappointed.

We had a wonderful experience at Maenam. Hands down the best Thai food in Vancouver! The staff were very friendly and accomodative of all our requests and the food was exceptional! My personal favourite was the BUTTERFLY PEA FLOWER DUMPLINGS. Absolutely mind-blowing.

Our anniversary dinner experience was awesome. Great ambience, staff, food and cocktails. JD (the Bar Manager) was a huge beauty. Definitely would come back. We both ordered the Chefs Menu (my partner ordered the vegetarian one) and both iterations were delicious.

This place is really amazing. I was starving and came in here with my date hoping to be seated quick. I was pretty skeptical when we were the only two people in the restaurant 30 minutes after they opened. We had the halibut Curry, the crispy rice sausage salad, and the beef stir fry. Everything was really delicious. So far, one of the best meals Ive had in Vancouver. What really blew my mind is we were the only table seated in the restaurant. I dont know why it wasnt packed. Ive heard my experience echoed by other out of towners that this is one of the better spots in all of Vancouver.
